Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend watching "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World". This movie is set in a magical Toronto that is inhabited by immortals. The main character, Scott Pilgrim, must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes one by one in order to win her heart.

Another movie that might interest the user based on their preferences is "Tuck Everlasting". This movie tells the story of a young man who falls in love with a beautiful girl named Tuck. The two fall deeply in love, but soon discover that they are both part of a family of immortals. The family has been living together for centuries, and the family members have all developed unique magical powers.

The main character, Tuck Everlasting, must use his magical powers to protect himself from the family's other powerful magical members who want to harm him.

As the main character fights off the family's other powerful magical members, he gradually realizes that he has been in love with a beautiful girl named Tuck all along.

I recommend "To Kill a Mockingbird" which is a classic novel about racism and social inequality in the American South during the Great Depression. The book is widely regarded as one of the greatest novels ever written, and has been adapted into numerous films, TV series, and stage productions.
The other two movies that you mentioned are "Braveheart", which is an epic historical drama directed by Mel Gibson about the life of William Wallace, a Scottish warrior who led a rebellion against English rule in Scotland during the 17th century. The movie is widely regarded as one of the greatest films ever made, and has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture and Best Director.
